title: Polkadot SDK PRDoc Schema
description: JSON Schema definition for the Polkadot SDK PR documentation

title.title: Title of the change
title.description:
Title for the PR. This is what will show up in the release notes.
if needed, you may provide a different title override for each audience in the `doc` property.

doc.title: Documentation adapted to the audience(s)
doc.description:
Description of the PR. Provide a description for each relevant audience.
See the `audience` property for more documentation about audiences

crates.title: Crates
crates.description:
You have the option to provide a hint about the crates that have noticeable changes.
 This is used during the crate publishing to crates.io and to help users understand the impact of the changes introduced in your PR.

migrations.title: Migrations (DB & Runtime)
migrations.description:
It is important for users to be aware of migrations.
Make sure to mention any migrations in the appropriate sub-properties:
- db
- runtime

db.title: Database Migration
db.description: List of the Database Migrations or empty array: []

runtime.title: Runtime Migration
runtime.description: List of the Runtime Migrations or empty array: []

host_functions.title: Host Functions
host_functions.description: List of the host functions involved in this PR.

audience.description: You may pick one or more audiences and address those users with appropriate documentation, information and warning related to the PR.

oneOf.title: Node Dev
oneOf.description: Those who build around the client side code. Alternative client builders, SMOLDOT, those who consume RPCs. These are people who are oblivious to the runtime changes. They only care about the meta-protocol, not the protocol itself.

oneOf.title: Runtime Dev
oneOf.description: All of those who rely on the runtime. A parachain team that is using a pallet. A DApp that is using a pallet. These are people who care about the protocol (WASM), not the meta-protocol (client).

oneOf.title: Node Operator
oneOf.description: Those who don't write any code and only run code.

oneOf.title: Runtime User
oneOf.description: Anyone using the runtime. This can be a token holder or a dev writing a front end for a chain.

crate.description: You have the option here to provide a hint about a crate that has changed to help with the publishing of crates.

migration_db.description: This property allows the documentation of database migrations.

migration_runtime.description: This property allows the documentation of runtime migrations.

semver_bump.description: The type of bump to apply to the crate version according to Cargo SemVer: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/semver.html. Please check docs/RELEASE.md for more information.

oneOf.title: Major
oneOf.description: A bump to the leftmost non-zero digit of the version number.

oneOf.title: Minor
oneOf.description: A bump to the second leftmost non-zero digit of the version number.

oneOf.title: Patch
oneOf.description: A bump to the third leftmost non-zero digit of the version number.

oneOf.title: None
oneOf.description: This change requires no SemVer bump (e.g. change was a test or benchmark).

doc.description: You have the the option to provide different description of your PR for different audiences.

title.title: Title for the audience
title.description: Optional title override for the PR and for the current audience

array_of_strings.description: An array of strings that can be empty

host_function.title: Host Functions
host_function.description: List of host functions and their descriptions

name.title: Host function name
name.description: Name or identifier to find the host function in the codebase

description.title: Host function description
description.description: Short description of the host function
